ACT
35
Witnesses of written wills before witnesses and public wills
When drawing up a written will in front of witnesses (Article 31) and a public will (Article 33), witnesses can be adults who have not been deprived of legal capacity and who know and can read and write.
The following cannot be witnesses when drawing up a written will in front of witnesses: neither a public will nor a will drawn up at the testator's request in the capacity of an authorized person: the testator's descendants, his adopted children and their descendants, his ancestors and adoptive parents, his relatives in the collateral line up to and including the fourth degree, the spouses of all those persons, nor the testator's spouse.
